go_data.justification: B7h/B7RP-1 binds the inducible costimulator (ICOS) receptor, which is induced upon T cell activation.
Expression of B7h is broadly distributed on multiple hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic tissues, raising questions as to its relative role in immune response regulation.
B7h is a costimulatory homolog of B7.1 and B7.2, which are cell surface molecules.
B7h/B7RP-1 binds the inducible costimulator (ICOS) receptor.
